Problem:
Consider a system described by the linear differential equation \\(dz/dt = Mz\\), where M represents a square matrix. We explore the consequence of applying a Fourier transform \\( F(z) = \\int e^{-i\\omega t}z(t) dt \\) at some initial condition and examine its impact on system dynamics.

If the Fourier transform \\( F(z) \\) is applied to the initial state \\( z_0 \\) at t = 0 and the system is subsequently allowed to progress under \\(dz/dt = Mz\\) without any intervention, will \\( z(t) \\) at t = T exactly correspond to evolution from \\( z_0 \\) at t = T?
Explanation: Applying the Fourier transform changes the state of the system by transforming the function into its frequency components. The evolution of these components under \\(dz/dt = Mz\\) can differ from the original time-domain evolution, thereby altering the state dynamically at time T.
